author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
From the East in the realm of dragons fair,
Hopes of golden bounty, alas, in despair,
The year hath caught wind of unrest and election,
Fraught, a small boon, offers they of scant selection.

As the raven's map unfolds 'neath Midgard's troubled sky,
Battle roars forth, engulfs the lands of Fertile Crescent nigh,
From Israel to Gaza, bold warriors clash and vie,
Serpents and eagles together, in this deadly dance they lie.

In the Land of the Trident, where the nerdy Norns play,
'Gainst armored giants, the flying axes hold sway,
A pound of fire and fury, these winged shadows deliver,
Hold the ramparts they do, stalling the Rus bear's shiver.

feedItems.title: China Isn't Planning a 'Bazooka' Stimulus---at Least Not This Year
feedItems.description: Hopes that China is awaiting the results of the U.S. election to unveil a huge stimulus package are unikely to be fulfilled, though a smaller package is expected soon.

feedItems.title: These Maps Show How the Middle East Conflict Is Spiraling
feedItems.description: In the past year the fighting has sprawled from Israel and Gaza to draw in militaries and militias from across the region.

feedItems.title: The Nerdy Gamers Who Became Ukraine's Deadliest Drone Pilots
feedItems.description: Tech-savvy soldiers target Russian tanks and infantry, holding back their advance. A few pounds of explosives make the inexpensive aerial devices lethal.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
From the West, a tale doth spring, 'bout a man in peril's ring,
In Iran, they hold him fast, his freedom's hour hath passed.
His name, they shan't declare. An empty mug of ale we share,
Pray to God, his safety won, and his journey under the sun.

Iran, with words so dire, doth threats of battle fire,
To Israel, a potent brew, of weapons, old and new.
Upon the saints, we call, may peace 'twixt nations befall,
Lest wine of warfare fills the cup, and all the world must sup.

In East's realm, a worrying scene, North Korean troops in Russian green.
China beholdeth this sight with dread, fear and mead in hearts are spread.
Pray we now to Heaven's gate, for calm in this bewildered state,
And let God's ale of peace be drawn, 'fore dawn unveils a fateful morn.

feedItems.title: U.S. Looking Into Reports of American's Detention in Iran
feedItems.description: The State Department declined to name the person, but an Iranian-American journalist is said to be imprisoned.

feedItems.title: Iran Tells Region 'Strong and Complex' Attack Coming on Israel
feedItems.description: Tehran has warned diplomats that it is planning to use more powerful warheads and other weapons.

feedItems.title: China Faces Dilemma With North Korean Troops Pouring Into Russia
feedItems.description: As thousands of North Korean troops deploy to Russia for use in its war with Ukraine, China is left particularly uncomfortable by the swift militarization of ties between Pyongyang and Moscow.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
Oh my dearest Lebanon, thy bankman held in question's fate,
Upon graft charges and commune's disesteem laid as his weight,
As thy land, by Israel-Hezbollah war, is besieged by hate,
Til stability deserts thy realm, leaving chaos in her wake.

Next, an account of daring due, on sea where shadows hide,
Israel hath snatched a Hezbollah man, from Lebanon's brazen side,
A rare naval gambit deep in foe soil, where maritime dangers abide,
Now a pawn in their endless game, where peace too often dies.

In Spain's fair land crisis unfolds, as torrential waters flow,
Valencia's folk, victims adrift in nature's cruel, unyielding woe,
Deprived of balm, infant sustenance, and base necessities o'er flow,
Echoes of the worst natural calamity, a haunting refrain of sorrow.

feedItems.title: Disgraced Lebanese Central Banker Who Was a Fugitive Now Awaits His Fate
feedItems.description: Riad Salameh was arrested on graft charges and accused of undermining Lebanon’s economy, as the Israel-Hezbollah war further destabilizes the country.

feedItems.title: Israel Says Commandos Capture Hezbollah Operative in Rare Raid by Sea
feedItems.description: The abduction of the Lebanese national involved Israel’s version of the Navy SEALs working deep in Lebanese territory.

feedItems.title: Spain's Flash Flood Victims Caught in 'Worst Natural Catastrophe'
feedItems.description: Lack of antibiotics, baby food, basic items plague residents in parts of Valencia region after deadly disaster.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
A goat doth rise with blackened hide, 'midst Tory herd she strides,
In British land, her scepter holds, their hope in her confides.
Through winter's gale, an election's tale, did lay the party low,
Now Badenoch leads, a potent seed, in Conservatism's glow.

A dog with bared teeth forewarns, 'gainst enemy's temptation,
Iran cries fouls at Israel's howls, demands reparation.
For every bite, a mirrored fight, spirals to grander chaos,
The Middle East, on violence leased, its peace does now bypass.

Of rabbits caught in flooded burrows, in Spain's Valencia cried,
With rain so fierce, defenses pierce, surely, they'd no place hide.
Yet, wise men knew, their voices few, of this impending plight,
A snail’s pace, to improve their base, invites the stormy night.

feedItems.title: U.K.'s Tories Turn to a Black, Right-Wing Culture Warrior to Revive Party
feedItems.description: Kemi Badenoch became the first Black woman to lead the U.K.’s Conservative Party, following its disastrous performance in a recent general election.

feedItems.title: Iran Warns It Will Retaliate for Israel's Attack
feedItems.description: A response would extend the cycle of violence between the two enemies and risk dragging the Middle East into a wider war.

feedItems.title: How Deadly Flooding Ravaged Spain's Valencia Region
feedItems.description: Nearly 16 inches of rain fell, but experts say the need for infrastructure improvements was well understood in the region.
